Description: Body sherd of North Ionian Wild Goat style pottery plate; slight remains of out-turn of foot or stem on underside; slipped cream. Exterior reserved; interior: glazed on right; protome of lion emerging from glaze to left; uncertain motif on left (perhaps goat?).
Curator's comments: The decoration appears to be lion's protome, not a complete lion; this might suggest a fountain-house.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.754)
